Summary: Watched object pass over four-corner intersection.
trends: There have been 7 other sightings in Peoria
There were no other sightings in Peoria on or around August 31st 1967
divs: sighting detailsafter seeing and listening to you on larry king's program the fourth week of september 2008, i decided to let you know what i saw once upon a time, mostly because i have not heard of any ufo described as what i thought i saw. my report was sent to project bluebook soon after sighting this object on an early balmy september evening as i walked from my car to my house, which was on a corner, carrying a bag of groceries. i called to my daughter, who was with me, "to look up" as i ran into the house, dropped the sack of groceries, and ran back outside all the while thinking what i saw might have been light reflected from electrical wires attached to a telephone pole at the corner--but knew better because what i saw was much larger than a telephone wire. i first saw the object when i happened to look up as i left my car and saw the object traveling slowly, quietly and clearly from north to south across the intersection, and then i couldn't see it anymore because of all the tall trees on down the street. i knew immediately it was something unusual that i was watching for a few seconds. it was shaped exactly like a neon-tube lightbulb only larger, approximately from where i saw it just above tree tops before it crossed the intersection and disappeared above the many other trees along the street. it was clearly visible against the dark sky, a brilliant yellow elongated object that made no sound and from my position on the street (and being seeminly so close just above the tree tops) to me measured about 10-12' long and 12-15" wide. the circular shaped front end (couldn't see the back end, of course) and the elongated rest of the shape is what looked like a brilliantly lit neon tube. the next day i told my boss (and nobody else for years)who was a usda public information officer, first asking him "would you believe i think i saw a ufo last night?" yes, he surely did, because he spent night-time hours looking for such objects and had been in contact with the well-known chicagoan named hynek (now deceased) who was interested in ufo sightings. i have read william cooper's "behold a pale horse" and believe every word he wrote. as you know, he lived near phoenix, and was murdered a few years ago. i wrote to him after my first encounter early on when i lived in peoria, ill.,about the ufo but my mail was returned "unable to deliver." i also had an extremely interesting experience while driving in a storm that actually slowed my car down to about 15 miles\hour because of ferocious winds. i lowered my window and looked quickly up at the sky where i saw a replica of a braided rug in shades of gray--coil after coil, but i could only see a portion of the "rug" because the rest of it was over my car top. when i drove down a hill, which was where the road led, i saw cars parked under an overhead bridge, but i kept driving because the winds had subsided. when i arrived home i heard radio news stating a tornado had passed over the area i was driving in about 15 minutes before. i wrote to the people who made the movie about tornados a few years ago, telling them what i saw but rec'd no feedback. wondering if you ever heard of such a sighting.
